{{Lang|'''Unu'''|hili=Unu|hili_tl=One}} is the name of the deity that Hilichurls worship. It is described as being "a holy word that embodies the hilichurls' concept of gods and the origin of life."<ref name="Handbook">{{Ref/Book|Handy Handbook of Hilichurlian}}</ref>

==Usage==
The word 'unu,' in addition to meaning 'one' and being used for expressing numbers, is used in some Hilichurlian compound words.

{| class="wikitable sortable" style="width=50%"
!Hilichurlian
!English
|-
|unu boya
|yellow<ref name="Handbook"/>
|-
|unu gusha
|seed<ref name="Handbook"/>
|}

*'Unu' likely derives from the Latin word ''Å«nus,'' meaning 'one' or 'single.'
*The word is used in several poems from [[Hilichurl Ballad Selection]].
